# draw

<!-- badges: start -->
<!-- badges: end -->

A package to generate gcode for a pen plotter. It can be used to create data.frames of x and y coordinates for shapes and lines, and to convert the data into gcode.

## Installation

You can install the development version of draw from [GitHub](https://github.com/) with:

``` r
# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("robbrotherton/draw")
```

## Example

```{r example}
library(draw)

offsets <- data.frame(group = as.character(1:6),
                      x_offset = rep(seq(1, length.out = 3, by = 1.5), 2),
                      y_offset = rep(c(1, 2.5), each = 3))

shapes <- dplyr::bind_rows(circle(),
                           square(),
                           star(),
                           polygon(sides = 6),
                           rectangle(width = 1.5, height = 1), 
                           heart(),
                           .id = "group") |> 
  dplyr::left_join(offsets) |>  
  dplyr::mutate(x = x + x_offset, 
                y = y + y_offset)

show(shapes, void = TRUE)


```
